location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 914 of 1823 from William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay to Captain John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulph [Persian Gulf]

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Resident that the Governor of Bombay approves of the tenor of his communication addressed to Sa‘īd bin Sultān Āl Sa‘īd, the Imam of Muscat, which concerned the restoration of the Beni Boo Ali tribe [Banī Bū ‘Alī]. However, it notes that the extent to which the Indian Government's treatment of this tribe is disapproved of in England should be more candidly explained to the Imam.
